page.title: 10Power, Wick
page.content: The Gas Works, which covers a five acre area, is situated at Gaultiquoy two kilometres west of Wick and was built in 1982 to replace the works in the centre of the town. The natural gas from the North Sea is taken north by two or three tankers weekly and is stored in three tanks in liquid form at -160 degrees centigrade. When the gas is required it is vaporized for domestic use.On average,15000 therms are used per week.Gas is supplied to consumers in Wick, not to the outlying country area.The Gas Works employs seven men.
